Row.Text: Two-player showdown along the Nile River between Egypt and Nubia. Lasts no more than 125 Turns.

The people of the Nile consider the number 7 to be extremely lucky.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It is both a symbol of perfection ...[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]... and a sign of completion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]So it shall be: the player who completes 7 Temples to Amun before time expires (125 turns) will earn that god's favor and triumph in this showdown between Nile river rivals.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]SPECIAL RULES:[NEWLINE]— Egypt and Nubia may not declare war on each other until Turn 20.[NEWLINE]— Once declared, wars cannot be ended.[NEWLINE]— Holy Site buildings can only be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith.
A historical map of the Nile basin.
You win this victory when first to build 7 Temples to the glory of the great god Amun.

+15% [ICON_Production] Production towards districts and wonders if the city is adjacent to a water tile. Floodplains do not block placement of districts and wonders. Start with the Fishing and Sailing technologies.

+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Ranged units. All Ranged units gain +50% combat experience. Start with the Mining technology. Mines over strategic resources provide +1 [ICON_Production] Production. Mines over bonus and luxury resources provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
